title: Avoiding seed oils is an online trend, but are they as bad as some would have you believe?
desc: Claims that seed oils are "toxic" and "inflammatory" are being circulated on social media, but they don't tell the whole story, experts say.

title: Trump Called for ‘De-Escalation’ in Minneapolis. It Didn’t Last Long.
desc: President Trump has offered dueling messages on the crisis in Minneapolis, part of a pattern of dialing back his rhetoric only to change again if the political winds are shifting.

title: Rents in Kampong Glam, Little India and Chinatown rose 'moderately' over past two years: URA
desc: The statement follows the announcement earlier this month that Warong Nasi Pariaman, said to be Singapore's oldest nasi padang stall, will close after nearly eight decades in Kampong Glam.

title: Soldiers overrun bandit enclaves, rescue victims in Kwara
desc: Nigerian Army's Operation Igbo Danu overruns Kwara bandit enclaves, neutralising terrorists and rescuing multiple kidnap victims in a sustained offensive.

title: Two Malaysian business leaders honoured at Asean conference in UK
desc: KUALA LUMPUR: Two Malaysian business personalities have been honoured for their distinguished work.

title: First-of-its-kind clinical guidance on psychedelic medicine released
desc: Unbound Medicine and Johns Hopkins Medicine today announced a significant expansion of the Johns Hopkins Psychiatry POC-IT Guide, a leading digital resource for clinicians and trainees worldwide.

title: 'I spoke to ChatGPT 8 times a day' - Gen Z's loneliness 'crisis'
desc: AI chatbots are being used as 'surrogate friends' by young people who have lost the ability to socialise.

title: Sporadic Nipah virus cases highlight importance of global surveillance
desc: The Global Virus Network (GVN), representing eminent human and animal virologists from more than 90 Centers of Excellence and Affiliates in over 40 countries dedicated to advancing research, collaboration, and pandemic preparedness, is monitoring reports of a Nipah virus outbreak in India and emphasizes that such cases, while very concerning and serious, are not unexpected or unprecedented. Sporadic Nipah virus infections have occurred almost annually in parts of South Asia, particularly in India and Bangladesh, and do not indicate a new or escalating global threat.
